00001 /*! \file sysdefines.h
00002  *  This file defines constants used by system calls.
00003  *
00004  */
00005 
00006 #ifndef _SYSDEFINES_H_
00007 #define _SYSDEFINES_H_
00008 
00009 /*! Return code when system call returns normally. */
00010 #define ALL_OK                  (0)
00011 /*! Return code when system call returns with an error. */
00012 #define ERROR                   (-1)
00013 /*! Return code when system call is unknown. */
00014 #define ERROR_ILLEGAL_SYSCALL   (-2)
00015 
00016 /*! System call that returns the version
00017  *  of the kernel. */
00018 #define SYSCALL_VERSION         (0)
00019 /*! System call that prints a string. */
00020 #define SYSCALL_PRINTS          (1)
00021 /*! System call that prints a hexadecimal
00022  *  value. */
00023 #define SYSCALL_PRINTHEX        (2)
00024 /*! System call that pauses execution
00025  *  by invoking the bochs debugger. */
00026 #define SYSCALL_DEBUGGER        (3)
00027 
00028 /*! System call that terminates the currently running
00029  *  thread. It takes no parameters. Terminates the process
00030  *  when there are no threads left. */
00031 #define SYSCALL_TERMINATE       (4)
00032 
00033 /*! System call that creates a new process with one single
00034  *  thread. It takes an index into the executable table in
00035  *  rdi. The program used is the executable whose index is
00036  *  passed in rdi. */
00037 #define SYSCALL_CREATEPROCESS   (5)
00038 
00039 #endif
